text: I remain a non consensus bitcoin bear: The problem with fiat currencies, like the U.S. dollar, is that monetary authorities can create an unlimited amount of new dollars or other currencies - making it look, to some, like a Ponzi scheme. The problem with crypto currencies,

like bitcoin and ethereum, is that anyone can make an unlimited number of new crypto currencies - making it, too, look to some like a Ponzi scheme. Ponzi schemes and scams are only visible to those that have no sense of history or want to believe in magic. I believe

Cryptocurrency can be viewed as Tinkerbell's light - its power source is based solidly on enough children believing in it. @jimcramer @tomkeene @cnbcfastmoney @SquawkCNBC @MelissaLeeCNBC @riskreversal @guyadami @FerroTV I would be short rather than long

numerous digital currencies. And P.S. I expected a rise in Bitcoin to the $40k plus area back in December when I did my 15 Surprises on @realmoney zerohedge.com/markets/doug-k… @threadreaderapp unroll
@cnbcfastmoney @riskreversal @MelissaLeeCNBC A "reference price" is a BS and made up share price by investment bankers. It has no relevance to anything. @timseymour @guyadami

@guyadami @cnbcfastmoney @MelissaLeeCNBC @riskreversal Respectfully, $HD quarterly report was not pristine: * While the comps were great, the cadence of the quarter disappointed. (Management: "May was weaker than previous months.")

* The #s were inflated by the ridiculous rise in price of lumber (which has now fallen for the 7th consecutive day). * Stocks usually move on the basis of rate of change - it has peaked for $HD as sales/profits have been pulled forward.
* $HD shares were $245 only two months ago. Peaked a week ago at $345. @tomkeene @SquawkCNBC @timseymour @threadreaderapp unroll

Most sold first and asked questions later regarding the Coinbase $1.25 convertible offering announced last night. yahoo.com/lifestyle/coinbase… The details of the deal (a likely low interest rate, wide conversion premium and, most importantly, the capped call transactions) - makes
the deal have very little dilution. I added on the weakness and I wrote on @realmoney it is a very smart

deal for the company and I expect the stock to rally as the market digests the news. @jimcramer @tomkeene @SquawkCNBC @cnbcfastmoney @riskreversal @revshark @lizclaman @SullyCNBC @Convertbond Relatedly, no one reads or does analysis anymore - they react to price.

As I have written we have the least educated trading and investor base ever - in large part because of the metamorphosis from active to passive investing. Twitter remains a vile cesspool of anonymity populated by many who reside in the cheap seats and never have or will be
on the playing field. Instead they display vitriol and uninformed banter. Not for me anymore - my presence will be sharply diminished. Enjoy the week and trade well. @threadreaderapp unroll
